title: How would you feel if Warlord's wasn't a Crit mastery at all?
body:
As in something like 'Dealing more than 10% of the target's max HP in a single attack heals you for 15% of the damage done and grants you 20% attack speed and 20 ability power for 4 seconds.'

It seems kind of silly that the sustain capstone is only available to crit-builders.

replies.body:
By my best guess, the point of the mastery outside of meshing too well with certain outliers is to reward champions who want to commit to extended trades. Do we want more assassins and siege champions to find the mastery appealing as well? I don't know, but it seems worth questioning how much champion flexibility is good for that kind of mastery before making such a change.

Doesn't seem unfeasible to tweak the idea a little though, whatever the goal decided on for such a change would be. For example, maybe adding in a radius limiting something like the proposed effect to proc on targets in close proximity would allow the mastery to extend more specifically to caster champions who also like to get in close and dirty, if that's to be deemed a wanted result.

I agree 100%. I've been thinking about it, and I've just realized that all of the healing masteries work for all healers, all the tank masteries work for all tanks, and excluding warlord's, all of the damage masteries work for all damage dealers. Yet warlord's is the one mastery that *has to* apply only to people who like crit, cough cough adcs cough marksman.

Yet warlord's is the one mastery that *has to* apply only to people who like crit, cough cough adcs cough marksman.

Fervor only triggering on basic attacks is a little more broad than Warlord's, but it's still more or less useless on caster-y folks.  But that's more or less what Deathfire Touch is for.

I see the Ferocity tree as being the Sustain/Sustained Damage tree.  We've got one sustained damage capstone for casters and one for auto-attackers, but the sustain capstone *only* works for crit-based champions.  And that's just silly.  Why would we want to give the option of focusing on sustain to such a narrow range of champions?
